title: Feature Request - Search inside the session output
author: jasb89
body_snippet:
I would like to be able to search for keywords inside the session window directly.

Expected Behavior
I would like to have a search button to search inside the session windows output for a certain word which jumps to the keyword. 

Current Behavior
Currently option not available

Possible Solution
Provide an option to search for keywords

Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)
N.A.

Your Environment
Version used: 1.75.7012.16814
Operating System and version (e.g. Windows 10 1709 (x64)

comments.snippet: Which protocol(s) would you like to see this in? It is likely impossible to do with RDP. I would have to look into whether this is possible with PuTTY as an SSH provider. It would definitely be possible if we moved to something like SSH.Net (#181) since we would have full control over the terminal window.

comments.snippet:
Honestly I'm not sure how this should be implemented as PuTTY (mRemoteNG's embedded SSH client) does not support this natively. Using ssh.net as statet by @sparerd (and requested by others, e.g., #181) might allow someone to add this feature, but generally I still have a hard time to imagine this to work without quite some issues and a lot of effort. 

One option you might use as workaround meanwhile would be to enable the session log in putty and search in there (e.g., as described here: http...
